meta.title: Grass Lake Community Schools / Grass Lake Community Schools District

meta.name: description
meta.content: This page is the opening page to our website that introduces individuals to our school district and the activities that are occurring.

$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.h1:
Grass Lake Community Schools
899 S. Union Street
Grass Lake, Michigan 49240
District Central Office - 517-867-5540

hr.h3: For our families using their Smartphones to view our website, go to https://bit.ly/2VDYB4T to access all up to date Continual Learning files.

div.h3:
No food deliveries on Mondays and Fridays
Double packs of breakfast/lunch packages on Tuesdays and Wednesdays
Triple packs of breakfast/lunch packages on Thursdays

br.span: INFORMATION ABOUT THE P-EBT FOOD ASSISTANCE PROGRAM

div.h3: Go to https://bit.ly/34TC5tb to get information toward being eligible for significant benefits for your family.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: If your family is living in a shelter, a motel, a campground, a car, a park, abandoned building, or sharing a home with another, your school-aged children may be eligible for services. Click on the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for McKinney-Vento Act Homeless Services Available

img.alt: GLHS Ranked in Top 25th Percentile in U.S News Report for 2020

a.span: GLHS Ranked in Top 25th Percentile in U.S News Report for 2020

div.p: U.S. News & World Report has posted its 2020 top High Schools across the United States, ranking 645 High Schools in the State of Michigan. Grass Lake High School is ranked in the top 25th percentile in Michigan. Click the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for GLHS Ranked in Top 25th Percentile in U.S News Report for 2020

div.p: Important dates for the 2020-2021 school year for Grass Lake Community Schools can be found by clicking on the heading of this announcement.

a.title: Go to comments for 2020-2021 GLCS Holidays and Breaks Announced

div.p: While the Coronavirus Covid 19 is being monitored by our government agencies, the Michigan Department of Education reminds all of us to maintain basic cleanliness and prevention methods that include: o Remaining at home if you are sick and avoid close contact with people who are sick. o Avoiding touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands. o Washing your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol if soap and water are unavailable. o Covering cough and sneezes with a tissue or sleeve. Provide adequate supplies within easy reach, including tissues and no-touch trash cans.

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus Protection

div.p: From time to time, school must be delayed or closed due to weather-related or emergency conditions. Every attempt is made to make the decision before 6:30 a.m. On rare occasions school may be delayed for two hours. Click on the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for School Closing Information

img.alt: Lauren Doser and Nathan Maynard - Spelling Bee Champions

a.span: Lauren Doser and Nathan Maynard - Spelling Bee Champions

div.p: Congratulations to George Long Elementary School 5th Grader Lauren Doser for winning the George Long Elementary 5th Grade Spelling Bee on Thursday, January 30, and to Nathan Maynard, who was our runner-up. Lauren will represent George Long Elementary School at the regional spelling bee on Wednesday, March 11, at the Western High School Performing Arts Center, where she will be spelling against regional 5th through 8th grade students. If for some reason Lauren is not able to attend the Bee, Nathan will stand in her place. Well done Lauren and Nathan!

a.title: Go to comments for Lauren Doser and Nathan Maynard - Spelling Bee Champions

a.span: GRASS LAKE STUDENTS ROCK THE 2018-2019 STANDARDIZED TESTS!

div.p: Congratulations to our Grass Lake Community Schools students and teachers as we review the results of standardized testing that was completed during the 2018-2019 school year. The growth among our students' proficiency levels, and our leadership in Jackson County, as well as our overall positive comparisons with all other State of Michigan school districts, illustrate very positive academic growth in our students' preparation for their successful futures. Well done!

a.title: Go to comments for GRASS LAKE STUDENTS ROCK THE 2018-2019 STANDARDIZED TESTS!

div.p: The staff at Grass Lake Community Schools educates students in three buildings that are located in the growing community of Grass Lake. Our school district has a proven record of continuous academic improvement. Our offerings include: 1) K-12 education, 2) our Little Warriors preschool program, which includes the Great Start Readiness Program, and 3) our Little Warriors child care program for children ages 12 months old through 12 years old. We boast a strong academic program that offers a variety of curricula, along with numerous interscholastic and extra-curricular activities that offer enrichment opportunities for all segments of our school population.

a.title: Go to comments for Grass Lake Community Schools Described

a.span: Our Grass Lake School Food Services Department Gives Thanks

div.p: Our Grass Lake community's benevolence is remarkable, and that includes a high level of giving toward our school district's food services department to help feed our students whose families find difficulty paying for their hot lunches. Click on the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for Our Grass Lake School Food Services Department Gives Thanks

img.alt: Information About Consequences of Making Threats in Schools

a.span: Information About Consequences of Making Threats in Schools

div.p: To the Parents/Guardians of Grass Lake Students: Due to some recent events that have occurred within Jackson County, it is important that we as a district once again stress the importance of student and school safety. Click on the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for Information About Consequences of Making Threats in Schools

div.p: Please note there are time restrictions in effect for student and parent automobile passage in our school parking lots and driveways that are in place for student safety and for maintaining clear routing for our school buses. Click on the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for Parking Lot and Driveway Restrictions

a.span: Fall, 2019 "Smoke Signals" District Newsletter Now Available Electronically

div.p: The electronic version of Grass Lake Community Schools 20-page "Smoke Signals" is now available. While you may have received the "Smoke Signals" in your postal mail, there are updated features and dates in the electronic version that came in after the hard copy went to press. Click on the heading of this announcement to find a link.

a.title: Go to comments for Fall, 2019 "Smoke Signals" District Newsletter Now Available Electronically

div.p: All Grass Lake Community Schools Kindergarten through 12th grade students are eligible to receive individual personal computing devices. With those devices come responsibilities for the students and the parents. New rules for damages have been instituted. Click on the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for 2019-2020 1:1 Computer Initiative Handbooks Available

a.span: Apply Now for Free and Reduced Lunches for Your Children

div.p: Registration has begun for Grass Lake Community Schools families to apply for Free and Reduced Lunches for their children during the 2019-2020 school year. We highly encourage our families to apply for this accommodation. Click the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for Apply Now for Free and Reduced Lunches for Your Children

img.alt: Grass Lake Community Schools "Order of Contacts" Established

a.span: Grass Lake Community Schools "Order of Contacts" Established

div.p: In order to assist parents and community members in addressing questions that may arise throughout the school year, the district has established the following process or steps that will guide you in speaking with the right person. Click on the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for Grass Lake Community Schools "Order of Contacts" Established

a.span: New Online Store Available Through Our GL Athletic Department

div.p: We have a new on-line store for the athletic departmental, and the link is this: https://sideline.bsnsports.com/schools/michigan/grasslake/grass-lake-high-school. Click on the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for New Online Store Available Through Our GL Athletic Department

img.alt: George Long Elementary Parents Share Their Experiences

a.span: George Long Elementary Parents Share Their Experiences

div.p: "Thank you" to parents of students attending George Long Elementary School for sharing comments about your experiences, and the experiences of your children, at George Long Elementary School given to us during this Teacher Appreciation Week. Click on the heading of this announcement for parent comments.

a.title: Go to comments for George Long Elementary Parents Share Their Experiences

img.alt: Technology and Youth: Protecting Your Child from Electronic Aggression

a.span: Technology and Youth: Protecting Your Child from Electronic Aggression

div.p: With the rapid proliferation of Internet access and the use of social media by our children, the Center for Disease Control has created a 2-page "Tip Sheet", along with a 24-page brief that offers parents and youth a full description of what "electronic aggression" is defined as, and describes ways to be informed and to help prevent electronic aggression.

a.title: Go to comments for Technology and Youth: Protecting Your Child from Electronic Aggression

div.p: It is our highest priority to keep our students in a learning environment that is safe and secure. Click on the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for School Emergency Procedures

img.alt: Pupil Safety - Our Primary Concern at Grass Lake Community Schools

a.span: Pupil Safety - Our Primary Concern at Grass Lake Community Schools

div.p: Dr. Kiser expresses to our Grass Lake Community Schools families that in light of the tragic events that occurred in Florida, it is important to our district leadership to remind each and every one of you that, above all else, student safety is our primary concern in Grass Lake Community Schools. Click on the heading of this announcement for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for Pupil Safety - Our Primary Concern at Grass Lake Community Schools

div.p: Many of our Grass Lake High School families will begin thinking about financial aid as our students begin making plans for paying for their education after high school. An important element to that process is the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). An online guide that will answer questions about the process can be found at https://www.affordablecollegesonline.org/financial-aid/financial-aid-for-online-colleges/

a.title: Go to comments for FAFSA Help Available Online

a.span: Bus Drivers Needed at Grass Lake Schools

div.p: Grass Lake Community Schools has openings for school bus drivers. Pay rate is $17.94 per hour. Contact the Transportation Office at 517-867-5544 for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for Bus Drivers Needed at Grass Lake Schools

div.h1: Office Hours, Contact Information, Educational Packet Information, Device Exchange Information

p.span: Accessing this document offers office hours for our three school buildings, along with information regarding the exchange of homework packets, and the exchange of computer devices for repairs.

a.title: Go to comments for Office Hours, Contact Information, Educational Packet Information, Device Exchange Information

p.span: Materials needed for continuing education will be made available to parents and students on an appointment basis on Wednesdays.

a.title: Go to comments for Instructional Packet Pickup/Drop-Off Procedure

p.span: Use this procedure if a device needs hands-on repairs by District technology personnel.

a.title: Go to comments for Computer Repair Procedure

p.span: Procedure for students to pick up or exchanging school-issued computer devices.

a.title: Go to comments for Computer Device Exchange Procedure

div.p: As we end our first week of at-home instruction, we are sharing some reminders of our processes, and asking families to make contact with our school buildings if any student is not currently in ongoing contact with school staff.

a.title: Go to comments for 4.16.20 Continuity of Learning Update

p.span: Superintendent Kiser explains our process for providing virual instruction through to the end of the school year on June 5, 2020.

a.title: Go to comments for 4.10.20 Superintendent Continuity of Learning Letter

div.h1: Superintendent's Corner - Information for Our Stakeholders

a.span: Reviewing Governor Whitmer's Executive Order to Close Schools

p.span: In this April, 2020, installment of "Superintendent's Corner", Superintendent Kiser reviews the Governor's Executive Order to close our schools for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

a.title: Go to comments for Reviewing Governor Whitmer's Executive Order to Close Schools
